alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 31 at 7:25PM CST until February 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Amite River At Denham Springs affecting Livingston and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point affecting East Baton Rouge Parish. For the Amite And Comite Rivers...including Denham Springs, Bayou Manchac Point...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Amite River At Bayou Manchac Point. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The river will begin to flood property along Bayou Manchac and the Amite River. Amite River Road and Horseshoe Drive will be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. The last observed value was 8.1 feet at 6:40 am this morning. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 9.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 02/04/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.
